intro: Anerincleistus fasciculatus, commonly known as the clustered leaf vine, is a tropical climbing plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that grow in clusters along the stems. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for its foliage and unique growth habit.
